Articles.Content:
Haven't seen a thread on this topic in here so thought I'd bring it up.

Personally I'd like to experience sitting on my living room floor and putting together a ship/jet/anything with my hands and  be able to walk around it and inspect it. I'm not a programmer but, naively, I don't think this would be hard to bring into the game. Also, sitting in the cockpit would be really fun to experience. I just found out KSP 1 has a mod thats been finally updated for 1.12.3+ and will give the flight and when I'm done working today I'm going to give it a try.

 

Either way, I know I'm not the only one.

 

EDIT: I have edited the poll, the intention of the options was to find where preference was for where VR would be wanted most. At the time of changing the poll was:

15 respondants (multiple choice)

9

5

6

 

EDIT 2: changed poll title to clarify that there is no timeframe implied

EDIT 3: added apathetic option

14 - 7 - 9 (25 voters)

It's not a priority. Good, detailed and functional flight decks / cockpits should come first.

It's not a priority. Good, detailed and functional flight decks / cockpits should come first.

I 'm not saying i want to see this feature at launch or 1.0...

I just want to see the feature dude

3 hours ago, Vl3d said:

It's not a priority. Good, detailed and functional flight decks / cockpits should come first.

I think those are a prerequisite for VR support. 
 

As for the main question, i think both building and flying would be nice. I don’t have VR myself, but people I know who do say that NMS gave them a better feeling of space travel than anything else they’ve tried, simply because of the immersion. Having KSP in VR might be the best representation of space travel as a whole in that medium. Sure there are very realistic space walk games and probably others that cover different aspects of space, but I bet that none deliver the combined realism, scope, and fun that KSP has to offer.
Would be so cool being able to build and fly ships in VR. Would really be a nice adition
